action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a sandwich, a orange, a apple, a peach and a banana.
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich.
You take the orange. In your inventory you have a sandwich and a orange.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a shelf, a chair, a table, a book and a couch. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a kitchen and a hallway here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You put the book on the table.
You can't see a plate here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry and a living room here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
You can't see a mop here.

You are in a living room now. There are a side table, a shelf, a chair, a table, a book and a couch. The book is on the table. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a kitchen and a hallway here.
